intro: Alyssum pichleri, commonly known as the Sierra Nevada alyssum, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in mountainous regions, thriving in full sun. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it produces small, round seeds that are dispersed by wind. Alyssum pichleri is often found in alpine meadows and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments.
